qas.question: What has this official language state done for Catalan?
Where is there nothing like this non-state speech community?
Besides being the official language and language of education, what other group uses Catalan?

context: Since the <a0_0>Spanish transition to democracy<a0_0/> (1975–1982), Catalan has been recognized as an official language, language of education, and language of <a3_0>mass media<a3_0/>, all of which have contributed to its <a1_0>increased prestige<a1_0/>. There is no parallel in <a2_0>Europe<a2_0/> of such a large, bilingual, non-state speech community.
